snippet.title: Ishido: The Way Of Stones (Tournament) [GB] - Real Time Longplay (No death)
snippet.description:
This is a, no commentary, Longplay of Ishido: The Way Of Stones for Game Boy, playing the Tournament mode. Another Game Boy game with no complete walkthrough on YT. In this video I use track 1 for music and Shapes as a stone set.

Ishido is a card puzzle game where you have to place 66 cards in a 96 array. The goal is to maximize your score by placing all cards on tiles and, especially, by making 4way-connections. Of course there are specific rules you have to follow in order to place cards next to each other to win (I won't explain the rules here as they are quite lengthy). There are 5 modes to play with (Solitaire, Tournament, VS Computer, VS Player 2 and VS Link). Unfortunately, Solitaire and Tournament seems to be exactly the same as there is no story or actual tournament and after winning/losing a game you can either start a new game or end it. Even though there is only a single game you can play, there is an ending screen if your score is high enough. Note that the higher the score the more fireworks you see on the ending screen.

The main drawback of this title is that it is strongly based on luck. The cards are shuffled at the start of the game and you have to be really lucky to have the appropriate cards near the end that fits the 4way patterns you have created with the initial cards. Consider yourself lucky if you manage to make more than 2 4way-connections.

Graphics are very basic but it's expected for such type of game. Music is good with a decent variety; there are 4 tracks to choose from (track 4 is formidable, heard it so many times). Gameplay is ok with responsive controls. No hint/pounch used. No death run (death=not see the ending screen).

In short, if you like card and/or board games, it's worth a try.

For a longplay showing Solitaire mode go here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YzOl5nCWEFU

For a longplay showing VS Computer mode go here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vTGOY47b0kg

---------------------------------------------------------------------
Game is played by me in one go. No save states/cheats have been used. Recorded in VBA23.2.

Please note I uploaded it just for fun, no intention to compete anyone.
